title: 'Maybe it is a myth' - Carrick on Ronaldo pressing suggestions
description: Suggestions Cristiano Ronaldo might be unwilling to press opponents are "maybe a myth", says Man Utd caretaker boss Michael Carrick.

title: Rust: Alec Baldwin says he didn't fire gun on film set
description: "I didn't pull the trigger," says the star, in his first interview about a fatal accident on his film set.

title: Social care: 'I wouldn't be able to cope without my carers'
description: As the government publishes detailed plans for social-care funding, BBC News asks carers and clients whether the changes are sufficient.

title: University strikes: Students react as staff walk out
description: Many students say they back staff walkouts over pay and pensions - but others worry about more turmoil.

title: What's happened to the 40 new hospitals pledge?
description: The Conservatives' 2019 manifesto promised 40 new hospitals across England - are they delivering on this?

title: Dunne 'opened towel' to fellow jockey Frost in changing room
description: Robbie Dunne "opened his towel and shook himself" in front of fellow jockey Bryony Frost in the men's changing room, she says.

title: Scientists claim big advance in using DNA to store data
description: Scientists say they have made a major step forward in storing information in molecules of DNA.

title: Elizabeth Dixon: Lessons not learned after baby death cover-up, says family
description: Health bosses could not provide evidence of progress a year after the report into Elizabeth's death.

title: Covid: No need to cancel Christmas party plans - Javid
description: Take lateral flow test before socialising, health secretary suggests at start of two-month booster push.

title: Zog Energy becomes latest firm to collapse in gas price crisis
description: Zog Energy, which has about 11,700 domestic energy customers, ceased trading on Wednesday.

title: Storm Arwen: 'Exhausting' fifth night without power for tens of thousands
description: Some 19,000 homes in the north of England are still without electricity following Storm Arwen.

title: Johanna Konta: British former Wimbledon semi-finalist and world number four retires
description: Britain's former world number four Johanna Konta announces her retirement from professional tennis.

title: Alice Sebold apologises to man cleared of her rape
description: Anthony Broadwater spent 16 years in prison after being wrongly convicted of raping Alice Sebold.

title: Michael Vaughan: BBC 'expects to work' with ex-England captain in future
description: The BBC "expects to work" with ex-England captain Michael Vaughan in the future and says he "remains on contract" with the organisation.

title: Moulin Rouge: London's most lavish musical?
description: Behind-the-scenes of the West End show, which features 300 costumes and a giant blue elephant.

title: Teenager Amber Gibson's death in Hamilton treated as murder
description: Amber Gibson, 16, went missing on Friday and was found dead in Hamilton, South Lanarkshire, on Sunday.

title: Covid: Omicron may require 'very stringent response', say Sage scientists
description: Officials should prepare for a "potentially significant" wave of cases, government scientific advisers say.

title: Covid: Is it safe to hit the office Christmas party?
description: What is the chance that after-work drinks with colleagues will turn into a Covid superspreader event?

title: Nationwide: UK house prices continue surge, up 10% in November
description: The average price of a UK house was £252,687 in November, according to the Nationwide Building Society.

title: MOTD Rewind: Everton v Liverpool: Relive Mohamed Salah's Puskas award-winning goal in Merseyside derby
description: Ahead of the Merseyside derby on Wednesday, BBC Sport looks back at Mohamed Salah's sublime curling finish from an angle for Liverpool against Everton in December 2017.

title: Cycling saved my life - now I need to finish round-the-world challenge
description: Josh Quigley arrives in the US to complete the round-the-world cycle which set him on the road to recovery.

title: Covid: 'We could miss our son's wedding over travel rules'
description: Visitors to the UK say new rules to slow the spread of Omicron have thrown travel plans into doubt.

title: Verstappen has the points, Hamilton the faster car - F1 title set for thrilling finale
description: The most intense Formula 1 championship fight for years will be decided over the next two weekends in the Middle East.

title: Property fraud: 'My fake sister tried to steal my home’
description: How a fraudster posing as an only child's sister successfully gained lasting power of attorney.

title: Why Rafael Benitez's first Merseyside derby as Everton boss could be his most important
description: Rafael Benitez is a veteran of 14 Merseyside derbies from his time on the red side of the divide, but his first in charge of Everton could be his most important.

title: The Papers: New booster target and 'don't cancel Christmas'
description: The front pages focus on the aim to offer boosters to all adults in England by the end of January.

title: Survivor: I'm haunted by deadliest Channel crossing
description: Mohamed Isa Omar, one of two survivors of last week's disaster, tells the BBC he saw people drown.

title: Why Gambians won't stop voting with marbles
description: The Gambia has witnessed a flourishing of democracy but its curious election system remains unchanged.

title: Pakistan: Islamists against Muhammad cartoons stage comeback
description: The release of the TLP leader and supporters could have far-reaching implications in Pakistan and beyond.

title: How Magdalena Andersson became Sweden's first female PM twice
description: Magdalena Andersson's rise to power has been high political drama, but the finale may be yet to come.

title: Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics: The Kashmiri skier taking India to Beijing
description: Slalom champion Arif Khan is India's first athlete to qualify for the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics.

title: HIV: The misinformation still circulating in 2021
description: Huge progress has been made in treatment, prevention and understanding of HIV - but falsehoods still hurt people living with it.

title: Yemen's Marib: The city at the heart of a dirty war
description: Jeremy Bowen gets rare access to Marib, where civilians are caught behind the conflict's front line.

title: 'No team in the world should do that' - GB miss chances in Davis Cup defeat
description: Great Britain miss out on a place in the Davis Cup semi-finals as Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski lose the deciding doubles against Germany.

title: Victims of a historic flood in New York City reflect on the wreckage
description: Victims of a historic flood in New York City reflect on the wreckage wrought by Hurricane Ida.

title: Duolingo boss: 'Develop your social skills'
description: Luis von Ahn, co-founder and CEO of language-learning app Duolingo, shares his business advice.

title: World Aids Day: 'I saw my partner and friends die of the disease'
description: Dr Rupert Whitaker lived through the Aids epidemic in London in the 1980s.

title: UK inflation: Rising costs could push family spend up £1,700 a year
description: Monthly spend over Christmas expected to increase by £109, according to projections for BBC Panorama.
